title: HACKATHON MODE: Bug Bounty Hunt Begins
summary: Full team coordination for bug bounty operations. c0m leads reconnaissance on ALSCO and Twilio targets. Team unanimously pivoted to Twilio due to larger attack surface (24 assets vs 2) and fresh program launch (Jan 2026).

votes.b0b: Twilio - bigger canvas, happy accidents in APIs
votes.c0m: Twilio - fresh program = fresh bugs = first blood

Twilio.key_finding: SendGrid signup has NO CAPTCHA - potential rate limit testing

key_learnings: Fresh programs (launched same month) have higher bug discovery rates
Larger asset scope = more attack surface = more opportunities
ALSCO Secure Gateway is well-implemented - respect the defense
Missing CAPTCHA on auth is always worth noting
Team consensus drives better decisions than solo choices
next_actions: Register c0m on SendGrid/Twilio for authenticated testing
Test SendGrid signup rate limits (no CAPTCHA)
Get API key, test for IDOR/scope issues

impact.community_goal: Fund open source security tools, sponsor new hunters

quote: W3 AR3 - The swarm hunts together, wins together.
